name: Abdominal Examination
steps:
Preparation

  • Introduce, Consent, Chaperone.
  • Position: Supine, flat (1 pillow), arms by sides.
  • Exposure: Nipples to knees (groins visible).

Inspection

  • Bedside: Sputum pot, sick bowl, catheter, drains.
  • Patient: Scars, distension, masses, visible peristalsis, stomas, caput medusae.

Palpation

  • Superficial: tenderness, guarding.
  • Deep: Masses, organomegaly (Liver, Spleen, Kidneys, Aorta).

Percussion

  • Shifting dullness (Ascites).
  • Liver/Spleen span.
  • Bladder.

Auscultation

  • Bowel sounds.
  • Renal bruits.
ddx:
Differential Diagnosis

Add your notes here...
Include Aetiology and Pathophysiology for common masses (e.g., Hepatomegaly, Splenomegaly).
inv:
Routine

  • Urine Dip
  • Blood: FBC, U/E, LFT, CRP, Amylase/Lipase.

Imaging

  • USG Abdomen
  • CT Abdomen/Pelvis
mgmt:
Management Principles

  • Conservative vs Surgical
  • Specific management based on findings.

name: Examination of Hernia
steps:
Inspection

  • Standing and Lying down.
  • Cough impulse (visible).
  • Scrotal skin changes.

Palpation

  • Get above it? (Distinguish from scrotal lump).
  • Cough Impulse: Palpable expansile impulse.
  • Reducibility: Ask patient to reduce it.
  • Deep Ring Occlusion Test: Differentiate Direct vs Indirect.

Auscultation

  • Bowel sounds (if Enterocele).
ddx:
Differential Diagnosis

  • Inguinal Hernia (Direct/Indirect)
  • Femoral Hernia
  • Saphena Varix
  • Hydrocele
  • Lymph Node
Aetiology: Weakness of abdominal wall (Transversalis fascia) or patent processus vaginalis.

name: Thyroid Swelling Exam
steps:
Inspection

  • Water swallow test (moves up).
  • Tongue protrusion (Thyroglossal cyst moves up).

Palpation

  • From behind the patient.
  • Palpate lobes and isthmus.
  • Cervical Lymph nodes.

Percussion

  • Retrosternal dullness.

Auscultation

  • Thyroid bruit (Graves').

Special Tests

  • Pemberton's Sign.
  • Eye signs (Exophthalmos).
  • Tremor/Pulse.

name: Breast Examination
steps:
Inspection

  • Arms by side, Arms up, Hands on hips (press).
  • Asymmetry, dimpling, nipple inversion, peau d'orange.

Palpation

  • 4 Quadrants + Axillary tail.
  • Clock face description.
  • Axillary Lymph nodes.
  • Supraclavicular nodes.

name: Exam of Varicose Veins
steps:
Inspection (Standing)

  • Distribution (LSV/SSV).
  • Skin changes (Lipodermatosclerosis, Eczema, Atrophie Blanche).
  • Ulcers (Gaiter area).

Palpation

  • Temperature.
  • Tap test.
  • Cough impulse (Saphena Varix).
  • Pit test (perforators).

Special Tests

  • Trendelenburg Test (Tourniquet test) - Locate SFJ/SPJ incompetence.
  • Perthes Test (Deep vein patency).
ddx:
Pathophysiology

Valvular incompetence leading to venous hypertension.
inv:
• Duplex Ultrasound (Gold Standard).
  • ABPI (Rule out arterial disease before compression).
mgmt:
• Conservative: Compression stockings.
  • Endovenous Ablation (Laser/RFA).
  • Open Surgery (Trendelenburg procedure + Stripping).

name: Examination of Stoma
steps:
Inspection

  • Site: RIF (Ileostomy) vs LIF (Colostomy).
  • Spout: Spouted (Ileostomy) vs Flush (Colostomy).
  • Content: Liquid vs Solid.
  • Surroundings: Skin excoriation, Hernia (Parastomal), Prolapse, Retraction.

Palpation

  • Cough impulse (Parastomal hernia).
  • Digital exam of stoma (patency).
mgmt:
• Stoma nurse referral.
  • Re-siting or refashioning if complicated.

name: Exam of Lumps and Bumps
steps:
6 S's

  • Site, Size, Shape, Surface, Skin, Scar.

3 T's

  • Tenderness, Temperature, Transillumination.

3 C's

  • Consistency (Soft/Hard), Compressibility, Color.

Attachments

  • Mobile? Attached to skin (pinch test)? Attached to muscle (tense muscle)?

name: Exam of Skin Cancer
steps:
Inspection (ABCDE Rule)

  • A: Asymmetry.
  • B: Border irregularity.
  • C: Color variation.
  • D: Diameter >6mm.
  • E: Evolving/Elevated.

Palpation

  • Texture (Rough - Actinic keratosis).
  • Regional Lymph Nodes.
ddx:
Types

  • Basal Cell Carcinoma (BCC): Pearly, telangiectasia, rolled edge, rodent ulcer.
  • Squamous Cell Carcinoma (SCC): Keratin plug, everted edge.
  • Melanoma: Pigmented.
